alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:29AM EST until December 22 at 3:24PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour affecting Washington, Jackson and Lawrence Counties. White River at Petersburg affecting Pike, Daviess, Gibson and Knox Counties. White River at Hazleton affecting Knox and Gibson Counties. White River at Elliston affecting Greene, Daviess and Knox Counties. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches will cause minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. Flooding may persist into Christmas Eve for portions of the White River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Elliston. * WHEN...From late Sunday night to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River approaching River Road north of CR 150 W in Greene County. Some low lying agricultural land begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early Monday morning to 19.0 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 12.7 feet and begin rising again Thursday evening. It will rise to 13.0 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1130 PM EST /1030 PM CST/.
